name: Bus Driver
description: In Bus Driver, your job is to transport passengers around an attractive and realistic city. You must drive to a timetable on a planned route, whilst obeying traffic rules, and taking care not to upset or injure your passengers.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 98/ME/2000/XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: 1GHz Pentium III or equivalent Memory: 256 MB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 1.3 compatible 64MB AGP with hardware T&L DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 300 MB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8 Processor: 1.5GHz Pentium IV or equivalent Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: OpenGL 1.5 compatible 128MB PCI Express with hardware T&L Storage: 300 MB available space Sound Card: DirectX compatible soundcard Additional Notes: DirectX compatible gamepad or steering wheel

reviews.review_text: A lot of people don't recommend because they come to this game thinking that they would shoot cops and kill people. What the heck were you thinking? This game is what it sounds. You drive. You drive. And you do missions. No free-roaming(which kinda sucks) but missions. If you want to drive a bus and pick up people, buy it. If you want to shoot people and drive cars, get GTA4 or Saints Row 4.

I bought the Euro Truck Simulator 2 pack for $19.99 when it was on sale, and I found this added to my library a few days after I got the pack. This game is very good to pass the time, and has decent graphics. However, it is not so much of a simluator as a game and there is no free-roam capability (but you can still drive anywhere while playing a mission). This is simular to Euro Truck Simulator 2 in the way that it is very picky; you get points docked for not turning on your blinkers while switching lanes, and the controls can sometimes be a challenge around corners. I recommend you should go through the controls before playing your first mission, because they don't tell you on their own. Another thing: You can't manipulate the camera. Most of the time, the camera is fine, but when driving in the neighboorhoods where there are a lot of trees, they get in the way of your view. The camera sometimes tries to move to help but usually doesn't make things better. The traffic lights also seem to be rigged; they don't stay green if you're approaching them. This annoys me a lot when I'm driving in the city, where there are 5-lane roads that are completely empty, and I am speeding down one towards a green light, which suddenly turns yellow (for what seems like a fraction of a second) and then red. 200 points lost for a traffic light offense. The AI of the other cars on the road isn't the greatest it could have been, too, and they don't seem to do anything when you honk at them. Despite its few disappointments, I still think this is an excellent title by SCS Software, and I think you should buy it.

It enables you to focus and concentrate for not doing mistakes so your hands will be locked to the game while riding the bus. The game looks old lets start with that right away. Not saying it looks terrible but does look old. However the resolution does support 1680*1050 so thats a plus. So it looks good on a modern system as in you dont see any black bars on the side. The game is very arcade like. The bus does feel heavy and does take some time to stop and you get penalized for not using blinkers and braking to hard and so forth. You get bonus points for not running red lights and using your blinkers.  The people act like cardboard cutouts. They do not move they just disappear into the bus and out of the bus. The city is big and somewhat ok looking. The fast food places where you drop people off have animated signs and their is weather effects in the game like snow. The camera view is not great. You have 2 views one in the very front and the chase one. The chase camera is a little on the lazy side and doesnt always give you a good view. I went with the front of the bus view for better control of the bus.  The music is terrible and not good. Sound effects are good. My Xbox360 gamepad I did finally get it to work however I could not get the braking right so I used Joy to key. Its free and works well. You can look this up online to download and use. They do have different buses you can drive so thats a plus. Overall I would recommend this if you can get it on sale. The original asking price of $10 dollars is a lot on the steep side. I bought it online for $4 dollars with 7 other games. The sale is still going on for another 12 days. Bundle Stars online. Also the other nice plus is the missions dont last all that long. Its very arcade like game.  So I finished the game. Took 7 hours. I had fun playing it. Some of the faults of the game that stand out lane changes penalties sometimes are random. Bus can go out of control very quickly. A very much arcade like experience.

Driving in this game is pretty clunky by today's standards and I swear it's not even analog? Or very bad attempt at it. But it's really fun to be driving around in cities picking up passengers and trying not to make them barf from all that unexpected hard braking. Prison levels are fun since you can drive with no restrictions so it's a long race to the prison haha. My only annoyance is that AI cars stop too fast. They brake from fast speed to stop almost instantly which is very annoying in traffic jams.

Driving a bus is alot harder then I thought it was. Also, this is a game I am more likely to play like once and then never again, I bought it in a bundle with Euro Truck Simulator and so I was like 'Since I bought it, why not play it?' then I began to play it, but I would recomend buying this game on sale, or if you're really into busses. Fun game, glad I now know what it's sorta like to be a bus driver,   7/10  Seven outta ten because it's not one of thos games you'll play alot, maybe a few times and then never again... But it is a fun game, and interesting.

Remember the old cruisin' USA style games for N64? That's what this is like, except buses. However, unlike just flat out racing, you have to pay attention to your braking, traffic lights, turn signals, proper door operation, etc. Very arcade style - and not so simulator like - but fun to play. Get it when it's on sale.  One of the cons - I'm using a Logitech F310 gamepad, and the steering is so finicky. I've tried adjusting the steering deadzone and non-linearity but I can't get the steering to turn quckly when I want it to turn. Might just be the game controller, as I remember playing this with a wheel when it first came out and it was fine.

More game than simulation -- New York Bus Simulator 2010 has better models and more precise controls -- Bus Driver replays a simple premise over and over again. The world is large and offers a variety of drives, though lacks realism and good traffic AI. Nevertheless the game is fun and addictive. For me, the average of ten minutes per mission is enough to get a bit of reward (versus committing an hour or more to NYBS2010).

This is obviously a niche game, so unless you know what you're buying, be prepared for disappointment. The game is great for what it is, but it is what it is: a slow paced game meant to simulate real life scenarios. If you enjoy speeding down the street in your fast car while playing GTA or NFS, this game might not be for you. Also, SCS' trucking games are different too, because between cities, they don't have that many rules to keep you tied. Bus Simulator feels more restricted, because you play in an urban area. You have to mind the street lights, the cops, watch your speed, be considerate of your passengers, etc... This all means the game is not bad, but it ain't for everybody either.

When I first saw this game on steam I didn't think it was a serious game. Probably because I was in a not so serious mood. Reading the reviews at that time I still could not believe it was a serious game. I was under the impression it would just be a game where you could screw over passengers and what not. Hours later I was not busy trying to cause accidents but I was busy trying to be a responsible bus driver. This game became very serious.   I really enjoy this game. Driving on the highway has never been this calming. You just have to put on some background music and off you go! This game even got me to use blinkers! I have never bothered in any game with blinkers but in this game I really do try my best to keep to the rules of the road.   Ofcourse no game is without a flaw or two and the same goes for bus driver. My biggest annoyance with this game is the timer. I understand that, as a bus driver, you need to be on time at the next stop. However, especially in later levels, this is almost impossible to do. Even if you were to drive through red lights (point deduction of 200) you will not make it. I suppose thats realistic as most of the time bus drivers are not in time but seeing as how it does count up at the end of the level I feel that that could have been made a little better. Not to mention that no matter which bus I drive there is an automatic speed limit on it. There are other busses in the same level that are going faster then I am.   All in all it's a nice game to play. If you have some money to spare and you would like a nice calming game and ignore the flaws that I mentioned then get this game. :)

You are a bus driver!!

Created on a lazy Saturday afternoon. Aweful to play. Driving is fine, but...  * Traffic is ridiculously bad:  - Everyone is driving at the same speed. No chance of switching lanes in a decent way.  - When there are multiple lanes, no one is using the right lane ???  - Traffic doesn't ever switch lanes. 4 Lanes and a traffic light? No one but you is going left or right.  * Timetables are impossible to keep:  - Even on full throttle (finger on forward ALL THE TIME), it is hard to impossible to stay on schedule.  * It's just driving around:  - There is no other purpose. No achievements, no missions, no nothing.  * Bonus and penalty system is super bad!  - Do something right 100/100 and get maybe 10/100 bonusses. Do the same thing WRONG?? Penalty 100/100.  - Transporting prisoners requires to follow a helicopter. Even on full throttle, you get a penalty for 'not following helicopter'??  I bought this 'game' (?) in a bundle. Do seriously not buy this! PLEASE!!! :)
